title: Handle removing a future that does not exist

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

body:
This fixes a panic when the future scheduler tries to remove a future that has already completed or been removed.

fixes #681

title: Remove tui_ prefix from TUI Examples
body: The TUI examples were moved into the TUI crate in #387, but the examples still have the redundant tui_ prefix. This PR removes the prefix.

title: bump lightningcss version

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body: Lightning css published a new alpha version with some minor breaking changes making CI fail. This PR updates to the latest version

title: don't remove real dom nodes when the id is recycled
body: The current implementation tries to remove nodes when the virtual dom recycles the id. These nodes should be removed with remove mutations so this behavior is not necessary, and it causes issues when the same id is set twice.

title: make the real dom generic over custom types
body:
Follow up to #648

This adds some extra bounds to the real dom to allow custom (FromAnyValue) types within the nodes contained in the realdom. The original code was missing these bounds which makes the unit value the only possible custom type

title: Fix potential typo: Strign -> String
body: Since it compiles without the fix, I am not sure if this is intentional or a typo.

title: Support optional attributes

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

body:
This PR adds support for optionally adding attributes with Option<AttributeValue>. This makes code to toggle attributes much simpler and more efficient.

closes #530

title: Fix the namespace and volatility of dynamic attributes

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

title: feat: simple signals implementation
body: Implements a new type of state API using `Copy + 'static` keys. The one downside is that the runtime that backs the signals needs to be leaked. We can reclaim the runtime safely by cycling them into linked list or slab, but can never shrink down to zero. Currently this is not integrated with templates or diffing, but we can eventually expose hooks for both, allowing for the full signal experience. This PR doesn't add "create_signal", only "use_signal" which taps into the regular re-render process of Dioxus. --- Going to merge this in an experimental fashion. Will test it against some examples.

title: Fix typo: propogate -> propagate
body: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/propogation

title: fix(Examples/Multi-Window): launch the popup content instead of app.
body: Not sure if my assumption is correct but it seemed this was the intention of the popup fn.

title: fix: properly canonicalize assets
body: Fix #687

title: Simple desktop multiwindow support
body:
Super simple multiwindow support.

If you want to communicate between windows, it'll require some channels or some shared context.

In theory you can get fermi to bridge the gap between two windows, but that isn't supported here.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10237910/210123113-3d43d4ba-21be-4e84-972c-a3a21e7df07a.mov

title: Move desktop context to main thread to allow file dialogs and expose tao/wry directly
body:
This PR moves the virtualdom onto the main thread, synchronizing the tokio runtime with the tao event loop, making it possible to poll futures while also reacting to window events.

I don't see anything like this in the Rust ecosystem at the moment - pretty cool stuff!

Now that the VirtualDom shares a thread with the window and webview, we can expose the relevant data directly down into the tree, which should help the uplink folks.

todo:
 - [x] fix use_eval
 - [x] handle all the events that we aren't
 - [x] general cleanups
 - [x] unbreak suspense

title: chore: clean up readmes
body:
Cleans up the readmes for several crates so we don't have weird descriptions that might be confusing to new users.

Also attempts to be less optimistic with what features exist since a handful of docs were written with todo!() features.

title: use lightning css to parse Taffy layout attributes
body: This switches from a manual parsing implementation for taffy attributes in native-core to lightning-css. This PR has support for all layout attributes Taffy currently supports and should make it easier to add more attributes in the future.

title: Pull translation out of CLI into its own "Rosetta" crate
body:
I've been trying to pull as much functionality out of the CLI into dedicated crates that live within the dioxus repo. We now have a bunch of utility crates like
- autoformatting
- rsx as a library not a proc macro
- hot reload as a library feature
- JS interpreter as a Rust crate

This is good because we can keep the ecosystem of tooling in lockstep with dioxus core as it evolves.



---

This PR extracts the translation feature of the CLI into a single "Rosetta" crate that provides transformation of any syntax into the Dioxus `rsx` syntax tree which is the foundation of hot reload, autoformat, etc.

The long term goal here is to provide frontends for any neighbor project (JSX, yew/sycamore/leptos, slint, etc etc) to take advantage of the tooling we've developed. It should also allow seamless imports of existing projects into Dioxus. This functionality powers the HTML-to-RSX translation today, but it could be easily expanded to allow JSX-to-RSX.

title: Fix copy paste error in docs
fix tui benchmark
body: Changes the tui benchmark to consume TuiContext instead of &TuiConext because consume context now returns owned values instead of references

title: add launch_cfg_with_props to tui
body: This allows creating an app with root level props the same as what the desktop and web renderer already have. This allows simplifying the tui benchmark.

title: fix mutations in native core related to keyed lists
body:
There were a few places the stack was being split at the wrong place and we needed to reverse the split stack in a few places before inserting nodes to fix the ordering for keyed lists

closes #676

title: tweak global attributes to follow the hot reloading PR, fix hovers actually showing, render doesnt throw errors anymore
body:
pulls out the changes from #651 to make the pr smaller.

Simplifies the macro a little bit too.

I also renamed "Element" and "Component" to prevent RA from auto importing the wrong one if you for whatever reason have rsx in a project together.

title: feat(DesktopContext): expose set_inner_size
body: the [Uplink](https://github.com/Satellite-im/Uplink) project wishes to be able to change the window size for a specific screen.  This PR exposes the `set_inner_size` function on the `DesktopContext` `EventLoopProxy`.

title: fix: dont send initialize until WS is connected
body: Fix #672

title: feat: complete the rollover of aborted and async render states
body:
This is the final blocker for the suspense work to get 0.3 released. The VirtualDom now intelligently knows how to jump between ready and async states.

The one thing I'm curious about is the `None` return type. Should we give it any semantic value? There's utility in having components that don't render anything, which is what it's currently used for. In 0.2, a `None` return type means that the component will defacto return a placeholder. I'm considering in this relase changing it so that `None` means `abort` and if you abort rendering early, the tree won't actually disappear. IE, you can memoize a component during render.

The one challenge with that is that it's not true memoization as that chunk of the tree is now in an invalid state since we have no choice but to wipe borrowed props and listeners before running a scope. The elements will stay but their listeners are gone and they can't respond to user input.

title: chore: rollback to option instead of anyhow
body:
After trying to use the error handling with anyhow, I don't really think it's worth the breaking change.

Error boundaries are best paired with exceptions. Currently, we don't protect the render tree from panics which is what error boundaries would be good for anyway.

The idea here is to pull back the Result changes are just stick with Option<Vnode>. If you want to throw an error, you can use the throw trait or panic.

The throw trait and panic will be implemented in a future PR.

title: feat: introduce simpler adapters for liveview
chore: add clippy workspace flag to check all crates
body: Clippy isn't really doing anything right now since it's not checking the whole workspace. This forces clippy to check everything

title: fix: core tests and use stack optimization for replace + remove
body: Fixes tests for core so master builds again. Transforms a remove into replace for more efficient mutation streams.

title: remove references to renderer features that do not exist
body:
There are some places in the docs that refence renderer features on the dioxus crate that no longer exist. This PR removes those references
followup to #387

title: allow changing the root name for desktop
body: This implements changing the root name in the desktop renderer similar to what the web renderer does. This is useful for multiple Dioxus instances running in the same app and fixes conflicts with another main element.

title: fix: advance dynamic root
Make borrowed props attached to the scope that created them
body: I had fixed this long ago but accidentally reintroduced it in #600 . This fixes it completely (hopefully!).

title: Revert "fix: liveview interpreter using new templates"
body: Reverts DioxusLabs/dioxus#655

title: fix: liveview interpreter using new templates
body:
Whoops, forgot to fix this.

Going to try and incorporate it with hydration and some reworking of the event model.

title: fix: scope rollover bug and router specifics
body: Should hopefully fix #653

title: fix fmt escape sequences in static attribute/text nodes
body: fixes attributes or text nodes with ```{{``` or ```}}```

title: Fix hot reloading
body:
Reimplements hot reloading

todo:
- [x] create trait for namespaces to implement that allows for hot reloading outside of the default html namespace
- [x] build Template<'staitc> from CallBody
- [x] create helper to diff CallBodys
- [x] web
- [x] desktop
- [x] companion PR to integrate with cli

title: fix non-ascii characters on web renderer
body: Bumps sledgehammer version to fix non-ascii characters in text

title: fix: replace fxhash with rustc-hash in core
body: It seems that https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/pull/600 has overwritten https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/pull/588 in the core package, this PR changes it again.

title: fix custom attribute value support
body:
Implements diffing on remaining attribute values and adds Any support in native core

It would be nice to accept a generic T as a value and then coerce it into Any, but I don't think that is possible without negative impls.

title: Return values from use_eval
body:
This allows returning serde_json::Value from javascript executed in use_eval. This solves the issue of querying data from the desktop renderer and acts as a precursor to #631. 

The desktop implementation needs to asynchronously return the result. The return type of both the desktop and web implementation implement IntoFuture so that they are interchangeable.

The web implementation has a .get() method to get the value without awaiting a future.

title: Tui widgets
body:
A version of #394 with a cleaner history that should be easier to review.

Add widgets to the tui renderer, and a general purpose cursor struct for any renderers.
Todo:
- [x] Textbox
- - [x] Basic Keyboard Editing
- <del> Insert Mode</del>
- - [x] Mouse Support
- - [x] size
- - [x] maxlength
- - [x] Use terminal cursor
- [x] Checkbox
- [x] Password
- - [x] Hide characters
- [x] Button
- - [x] onclick
- [x] Number
- - [x] Limit to only numbers
- - [x] Up/Down with arrow keys
- - [x] Up/Down buttons
- [x] Range
- - [x] Left/Right with keyboard
- - [x] Mouse Support
- - [x] Min/Max
- - [x] Step

Demo:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66571940/167262687-a8423500-00ae-4ac6-883a-899b59b646f8.mp4
 
Future work: pass through global attributes

title: chore: rename all &cx to cx, make clipppy happy, general cleanups
body:
#600 enabled the use of cx instead of &cx in hooks, and this PR implements that across the board for all the examples, docs, and comments

Also fixes various little bugs across the repo, letting CI pass again
- remove tui from the "exclude" list 
- fix arbitrary attribute names getting the wrong namespace
- split out shared_state and context API

title: build(deps): bump actions/checkout from 2 to 3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [actions/checkout](https://github.com/actions/checkout) from 2 to 3.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v3.0.0

  • Updated to the node16 runtime by default
    • This requires a minimum Actions Runner version of v2.285.0 to run, which is by default available in GHES 3.4 or later.

v2.5.0

What's Changed

  • Update @​actions/core to 1.10.0 by @​rentziass in actions/checkout#962

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2...v2.5.0

v2.4.2

What's Changed

  • Add set-safe-directory input to allow customers to take control. (#770) by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#776
  • Prepare changelog for v2.4.2. by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#778

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2...v2.4.2

v2.4.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory

v2.4.0

  • Convert SSH URLs like org-<ORG_ID>@github.com: to https://github.com/ - pr

v2.3.5

Update dependencies

v2.3.4

  • Add missing awaits
  • Swap to Environment Files

v2.3.3

  • Remove Unneeded commit information from build logs
  • Add Licensed to verify third party dependencies

v2.3.2

Add Third Party License Information to Dist Files

v2.3.1

Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

Changes to support GHES (here and here)

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from actions/checkout's changelog.

Changelog

v3.1.0

  • Use @​actions/core saveState and getState
  • Add github-server-url input

v3.0.2

  • Add input set-safe-directory

v3.0.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory
  • Bumped various npm package versions

v3.0.0

  • Update to node 16

v2.3.1

  • Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

  • Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

  • Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

  • Changes to support GHES (here and here)

v2.1.0

  • Group output
  • Changes to support GHES alpha release
  • Persist core.sshCommand for submodules
  • Add support ssh
  • Convert submodule SSH URL to HTTPS, when not using SSH
  • Add submodule support
  • Follow proxy settings
  • Fix ref for pr closed event when a pr is merged
  • Fix issue checking detached when git less than 2.22

v2.0.0

  • Do not pass cred on command line
  • Add input persist-credentials
  • Fallback to REST API to download repo
Commits
  • 93ea575 Prepare release v3.1.0 (#940)
  • 6a84743 Bump @​actions/core to 1.10.0 (#939)
  • e6d535c Inject GitHub host to be able to clone from another GitHub instance (#922)
  • 2541b12 Prepare changelog for v3.0.2. (#777)
  • 0ffe6f9 Add set-safe-directory input to allow customers to take control. (#770)
  • dcd71f6 Enforce safe directory (#762)
  • add3486 Patch to fix the dependbot alert. (#744)
  • 5126516 Bump minimist from 1.2.5 to 1.2.6 (#741)
  • d50f8ea Add v3.0 release information to changelog (#740)
  • 2d1c119 update test workflows to checkout v3 (#709)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: build(deps): bump Swatinem/rust-cache from 1 to 2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [Swatinem/rust-cache](https://github.com/Swatinem/rust-cache) from 1 to 2.
Release notes

Sourced from Swatinem/rust-cache's releases.

v2.0.0

  • The action code was refactored to allow for caching multiple workspaces and different target directory layouts.
  • The working-directory and target-dir input options were replaced by a single workspaces option that has the form of $workspace -> $target.
  • Support for considering env-vars as part of the cache key.
  • The sharedKey input option was renamed to shared-key for consistency.

v1.4.0

  • Clean both debug and release target directories.

v1.3.0

  • Use Rust toolchain file as additional cache key.
  • Allow for a configurable target-dir.

v1.2.0

  • Cache ~/.cargo/bin.
  • Support for custom $CARGO_HOME.
  • Add a cache-hit output.
  • Add a new sharedKey option that overrides the automatic job-name based key.

v1.1.0

  • Add a new working-directory input.
  • Support caching git dependencies.
  • Lots of other improvements.

v1.0.1

  • Improved logging output.
  • Make sure to consider all-features dependencies when pruning.
  • Work around macOS cache corruption.
  • Remove git-db cache for now.
Changelog

Sourced from Swatinem/rust-cache's changelog.

Changelog

2.2.0

  • Add new save-if option to always restore, but only conditionally save the cache.

2.1.0

  • Only hash Cargo.{lock,toml} files in the configured workspace directories.

2.0.2

  • Avoid calling cargo metadata on pre-cleanup.
  • Added prefix-key, cache-directories and cache-targets options.

2.0.1

  • Primarily just updating dependencies to fix GitHub deprecation notices.

2.0.0

  • The action code was refactored to allow for caching multiple workspaces and different target directory layouts.
  • The working-directory and target-dir input options were replaced by a single workspaces option that has the form of $workspace -> $target.
  • Support for considering env-vars as part of the cache key.
  • The sharedKey input option was renamed to shared-key for consistency.

1.4.0

  • Clean both debug and release target directories.

1.3.0

  • Use Rust toolchain file as additional cache key.
  • Allow for a configurable target-dir.

1.2.0

  • Cache ~/.cargo/bin.
  • Support for custom $CARGO_HOME.
  • Add a cache-hit output.
  • Add a new sharedKey option that overrides the automatic job-name based key.

1.1.0

  • Add a new working-directory input.
  • Support caching git dependencies.
  • Lots of other improvements.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 359a70e 2.2.0
  • ecee04e feat: add save-if option, closes #66 (#91)
  • b894d59 2.1.0
  • e78327d small code style improvements, README and CHANGELOG updates
  • ccdddcc only hash Cargo.toml/Cargo.lock that belong to a configured workspace (#90)
  • b5ec9ed 2.0.2
  • 3f2513f avoid calling cargo metadata on pre-cleanup
  • 19c4658 update dependencies
  • b8e72aa Added prefix-key cache-directories and cache-targets options (#85)
  • 22c9328 2.0.1
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: Optimize Web Template Implementation
body:
This branch is built on #600 and #630.

- Uses [sledgehammer-bindgen](https://crates.io/crates/sledgehammer_bindgen) to batch operations to js.
- - The Js is about one third the size of the previous interperter
- Uses [smallbox](https://andylokandy.github.io/smallbox/doc/smallbox/index.html) to replace lazy nodes.
- Uses Fxhash wherever possible.
- Template ids are first hashed in rust before being passed to js.

Templates-v3:
![Screenshot 2022-12-06 220444](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66571940/206085717-5ac4f2df-2f3e-41b7-a6d2-102b6bb7c6d2.png)

This branch without rif-raf:
![Screenshot 2022-12-06 210056](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66571940/206085788-6be813ee-83bc-4147-a657-70d784180a59.png)

With rif-raf:
![Screenshot 2022-12-06 194801](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66571940/206085755-9f7c56f0-4c51-48dc-b082-f738b8a9a2d3.png)

The Dioxus overhead benchmark shows a improvement of ~20%

title: Add Dependabot configuration for GitHub Actions updates
body:
This PR adds a Dependabot configuration that checks once a week if the GitHub Actions are still using the latest version. If not, it opens a PR to update them.

It will actually open few PRs, since only major versions are specified (like v3), so only on a major release (like v4) it will update and open a PR. But it helps actively keep GitHub Actions workflows up to date and secure.

See [Keeping your actions up to date with Dependabot](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/working-with-dependabot/keeping-your-actions-up-to-date-with-dependabot).

title: Update ZH_CN.md
body: Update ZH_CN README File

title: Implement new mutations with native core
body:
Integrates with #600 to implement the mutations for native core.

This also contains some general refactoring to separate the slab allocated tree data structure from the RealDom. It adds a shared view wrapper that allows parallel access to the tree so that resolving the state can be distributed between many thread.

Generally this shrinks the macro and moves work of choosing passes to runtime to make multithreading work. This is also more testable, and I added some tests for the tree data structure.

title: Build failure on master.
fix desktop dependency `wry`
body:
`dioxus-desktop` currently depends on `wry` via git.

This is an issue because:
1. The specified branch (`release`) doesn't seem to exist within the [wry repository](https://github.com/tauri-apps/wry).
2. IIRC crates.io doesn't allow git dependencies.
3. The specified version is already available via crates.io

This PR fixes all of the above by changing the dependency back to crates.io.

title: Fix the Android support disagreement in the docs
body: See #613

title: Implement push view for ios.
body: So this would allow drawing an ios screen ontop of the webview that could be exited later. Is this a feature we can add to dioxus?

title: fix tui example links
body:
- Fixes the example links for tui
- Removes the tui keys example (this example is covered by the all_events_example)
- Renames the tui_frame to tui_flex. The example doesn't have anything to do with frames... It seems to be demonstrating flexbox support.

A lot of the tui examples are just copies of desktop examples. It probably makes sense to set up some configs in the future to combine the examples.

title: Update wry to 0.22.0
body:
The 0.22.0 release should be imminent.

- [0] https://github.com/tauri-apps/wry/pull/698

title: Some fixes for wayland and ios.
body: Updating to webbrowser 0.8.0 fixes compiling for ios, while not crashing if the webview isn't initialized yet fixes an issue encountered on sway/wayland/linux.

title: Template architecture, async components, inline iterators, error boundaries, multiple renderers
body:
This PR is doing some major overhauls to the Dioxus core engine, adding a bunch of new features and generally making Dioxus faster.

- The architecture of Dioxus is being re-centered around the template work #488 
- Components can now be async and will block the rendering of their nearest suspense boundary until ready
- The virtualdom can now order changes for different renderers in the same stream, unlocking multiwindow desktop apps
- unterminated if/then and for loops with rsx bodies (experimental, may revert this)
- internal tasks and futures are way more efficient, using their own dedicated waker 
- SSR now has a cache for all static content it's seen before, making it much faster
- hooks don't need to create a reference. IE `use_state(cx, ` works automatically now

Todo
- [x] SSR Cache
- [ ] Finish cleaning up SSR crate and overhaul its docs and APIs
- [x] Rip out old vnode in favor of template-only vnode
- [x] implement `create` method with templates
- [x] implement async components
- [x] implement suspense boundaries
- [x] a dedicated waker for futures inside the dom that doesn't require Rc
- [x] Sanitize method on mutations to wipe template IDs for testing
- [x] fix pointer stability issues with new bumpslab crate
- [x] get diffing working
- - [x] Basic template <-> template
- - [x] Old template to new template light internal diffing
- - [ ] handle async rollover
- - [ ] handle error boundary rollover
- [x] rework garbage collection
- [ ] wire up subtrees into resume logic
- [x] Element is no longer Option<T> but anyhow::Result<T>
- [ ] Error boundaries and render cancelling

Tests
- [x] We don't hand out null ptrs
- [x] creating text
- [x] creating elements
- [x] creating fragments
- [x] Creating placeholders
- [x] Tasks get polled
- [x] Components pass through their children
- [x] creating suspense
- [ ] Errors get bubbled to a suspense boundary
- [ ] Errored components cancel their render
- [x] Diffing templates with just components
- [x] Dynamic-only templates don't generate CreateTemplate mutations
- [x] Diffing templates with the same ID
- [x] Diffing templates with different IDs should light diff and then replace
- [x] Mounting dynamic roots should not use LoadTemplate
- [x] Unkeyed diffing ordering
- [x] Keyed diffing ordering
- [x] No leaking when the virtualdom is dropped
- [x] Drop safety before running listeners
- [x] Suspended components should not respond to user events
- [ ] Rolling from nodes to async nodes should not wipe the old tree - render gen doesn't advance

Future todo
- rework some docs
- blog posts on the changes
- transition components
- Default error screen? Currently we just panic if an error gets bubbled to the root


Notes
----
Apparently "clear all children" is not fast - clearing each node one-by-one is!

title: fix inserting dynamic nodes after fragments

labels.name: web
labels.description: relating to the web renderer for dioxus

body: Fixes inserting dynamic nodes in templates after a fragment. This resolves all dynamic paths before they are use which results in a slight performance hit on creating nodes but better performance on accessing dynamic nodes after they are created.

title: Update elements.rs
body: Add missing `datetime` attribute to the `time` tag.

title: replace fxhash crate with rustc-hash
body:
The rust performance book recommends using rustc-hash instead of fxhash for maintenance reasons - https://nnethercote.github.io/perf-book/hashing.html

"[rustc-hash](https://crates.io/crates/rustc-hash) provides FxHashSet and FxHashMap types that are drop-in replacements for HashSet and HashMap. Its hashing algorithm is low-quality but very fast, especially for integer keys, and has been found to out-perform all other hash algorithms within rustc. ([fxhash](https://crates.io/crates/fxhash) is an older, less well maintained implementation of the same algorithm and types.)"

Do you see any reasons against this? Let me know what you think!

title: fix: master containing random commit that's failing master build
body: Unsure of how these slipped in - might've been pending work when switching between branches.

title: Make render marco bypass lazynodes
body: The render macro doesn't need lazy nodes. It can use the node factory directly without the overhead of calling LazyNodes::new or LazyNodes::call

title: to_owned!: allow optional comma at the end
optimizations for wasm size
body:
Moves logging into a feature flag, and removes a few dependencies that only have one usage.
For the js-framework benchmark these changes save the zipped wasm 6 kb (off of 111 kb).

title: design: make the homepage snazzier
Refactor Mutations and simplify Templates
body:
This moves templates to only exist in the vdom instead of the renderer. Templates exist to speed up diffing in the vdom, and to speed up node creation via cloning. This shifts templates from explicitly existing in renderers to being used via a CloneNode, NextSibling, FirstChild, etc. This simplifies the implementation and provides better performance for the web renderer.

- Also exploring non-stack based mutations as they are less useful with templates

todo:
- [x] new edits
- [x] web implementation
- [x] desktop implementation
- [x] native-core implementation
- [x] tui implementation
- [x] update native core and dioxus tests
- [x] Fix multiple iterators that are children of the same element

benchmarks:
![Screenshot 2022-10-08 160106](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66571940/194727698-75cd70f2-9356-42d4-9201-c2cf151e0b28.png)

title: Fix attribute value in macro
body: Adds auto conversion for anything that can be converted to an attribute value.

title: fix: Remove a Node listeners when it is removed
body:
This will clean up all the listeners of a Node when it's removed.

I noticed while using `get_listening_sorted()` it would sometimes panic because it was unable to find a removed Node that previously had a listener. With this fix, the listeners and the node list should be on sync, so whenever you try to retrieve all the node listeners it should only get Nodes that actually exist.

Note: I haven't actually tested these changes with the new changes from https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/commit/047ed1e5536d266785240fb3db475ac2fc77b785

title: pass clippy
body: Fixes the clippy errors introduced by #488

title: Add arbitraryAttributeValue to ownedAttributeValue
body:
This works, but it requires an extra clone bound on ArbitraryAttributeValue to allow for a owned variant.

fixes #572

title: chore: fixes to autoformat to prevent double rendering of expr line
body:
I've been dogfooding the extension to knock out any bugs and noticed this was giving some headache.

I've added some more tests for the cases that autoformat was breaking on.

title: fix scroll data
body:
fixes #566

This adds a event data type for the onscroll event, instead of using the mouse data type. The onscoll event does not contain any data about the pointer on the web platform: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scroll_event#event_type

title: Feat: Make AttributeValue::Any usable
body:
## Changes:
- Implemented `Display` for `AttributeValue::Any`
- Made `ArbitraryAttributeValue` public outside the `core` crate

Note about the first change: 
Just like https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/pull/543, I went using `{:?}`, but if you think necessary it can be changed to simply:

```rust
AttributeValue::Any(_) => write!(f, ""),
```

This way it won't actually write anything in the buffer... but that's okay? It works fine both ways, I still don't know why `AttributeValue` needs to implement `Display`.

Thoughts?

title: feat: simple iterators and conditionals in rsx
fix: use typeid of atoms for their unique ID
Revert "fix: use typeid of atoms for their unique ID to prevent down casting panics"
body: Reverts DioxusLabs/dioxus#555

title: feat: add an unhygenic render macro
fix: use typeid of atoms for their unique ID to prevent down casting panics
body:
The previous implementation of AtomIds for Fermi could lead to downcast errors if Rust merged two statics together.

Now, we only downcast a type if the TypeId is verified to match by adding its TypeId into its AtomId.

This prevents the particular issue but doesn't help with Rust merging statics together.

In apps that actually use their atoms, this won't be an issue (hopefully).

Fixes #536

title: Less clumsy configuration for desktop and mobile
body: In the spirit of breaking changes to reduce some sharp edges, this PR introduces a more straightforward pattern for configuration of desktop and web apps. This brings these platforms in line with the TUI crate which has always expected an explicit configuration object.

title: general cleanups to examples, docs and random code
Remove lower case components that use the paran syntax
body:
This implementation had the unfortunate side-effect of colliding with regular function calls leading to a sore point. This gets rid of that implementation and only allows lowercase components if they use the path syntax.

This is implemented to make room for #550 and regular helper functions being more common.

title: feat: implement type magic to allow strings, format args, and other types directly in rsx
feat: use infer instead of outdated mime-guess, bump wry
body: Infer is more robust that mime-guess for loading assets from the file system.

title: add missing global attributes
body:
Adds the remaining global attributes from the [MDN global attributes docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes) to the global attribute namespace.

fixes #534

title: docs: Fix Fermi's usage instructions
body: Just a quick fix for Fermi's usage instructions

title: feat: Support Bytes type in AttributeValue
body:
I am not yet familiarized with the core codebase so I am not sure why this is needed, but looks like I need it, otherwise it would just panic.

Context: I am working on my own renderer and I am implementing an image element with an attribute that receives the content of the image in form of bytes.

I tried it with these changes and it worked :)

title: fix: set false for media event bubbling
body:
Closes #541 

This simply sets media events false in `pub fn event_bubbles`. I've confirmed this works in https://github.com/erichulburd/dioxus-audio-tag-event-bugs/tree/with_applied_fix

However, I'm unsure about your integration test setup here. How and where should I add tests?

Also, I was unable to find a definitive source of truth for event bubbling. MDN marks _some_ events as bubbling (eg [canplay](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/canplay_event)), but not others (eg [onloadedmetadata](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/loadedmetadata_event)).

I would assume there is some specification out there that we can reference in a docstring, but I was unable to find it.

title: Add liveview Salvo integration
Added dialog tag
expose DesktopConfig in public interface
body:
fixes #511 and #512
It also comments out with_event_handler because it is currently not implemented.

title: Improve documentation for the native core and native core macro crates
body: Adds more internal comments and documentation to the native core and native core macro crates. It also renames some private functions/types to improve readability.

title: Fix propagation docs
body: Fixes #525: wrong example provided in the "Stopping propagation" section.

title: Update Docs CI with mdbook translation support
body:
Fixes #514

mdbook is build from source until the feature is released, then we can go back to previous action.
Example paths where updated to point to the right place also :)

title: allow duplicate variables in format_args_f
body:
currently this fails to compile:
```rust
let x = 0;
rsx!{
  "{x} {x}"
}
```
This is because the format_args_f macro transforms it into
...
format_args!("{x} {x}", x = x x = x)
...
which contains duplicates that are not allowed in format_args.
This PR deduplicates the assignments.

title: Fix typos and update code on custom renderer docs
body:
Hey!

Just a quick PR fixing some typos and and code samples.

title: Added initial_url to the router component
body: It seems that there was no way, nor workaround to set an active url when doing ssr, so I added a new prop to the router component.

title: Fix weird docs typo/copy-paste error
body:
Introduced in a8952a9ee8d8831fa911cef4e7035293c3a9f88b and 4518b6bc8cfbe246d0844b2a32f11f437115d00d by @jkelleyrtp  
Spotted while reading the docs. I don't know how this happened (twice!), perhaps some find-and-replace or editor macro trickery. It was pretty easy to deduce correct text though.
